body.p: When editing an xml file eclim will default to validating the file when it is written. Any errors will be added to vim's quickfix window and their corresponding line number noted via vim's sign functionality.
body.note: To prevent overwritting your quickfix buffer after a :make or :grep, eclim will only place the validation errors in the quickfix buffer if the buffer does not contain results from any user initiated quickfix commands (make, grep, vimgrep, etc.).
body.p: If you don't want xml files validated when saving them, you can set the g:EclimXmlValidation variable described in the configuration section below.
Regardless of whether you have validation enabled upon saving or not, the following command is still available for validating xml files on demand.

:Validation [<file>]
Validate the supplied file or the current file if no file name provided.
If eclimd is not currently running, and the xmllint command is available, eclim will validate the xml file using that. Eclim will never use xmllint when saving the file with g:EclimXmlValidation enabled.

ul.li:
g:EclimXmlValidation
If set to 0, disables xml validation when saving the file.
